text.title: Alipurduar
text.p:
Alipurduar
is located in the north-east corner of
West Bengal
, bordering on
Bhutan
and
Assam
.
It is the headquarters Alipurduar district .
The area is in eastern Dooars , Himalayan foothills , with thick forests and a variety of wildlife .
The entire region exudes great scenic beauty .

p.s: Alipurduar Junction railway station is on the New Jalpaiguri-Alipurduar-Samuktala Road line ( originally metre gauge but later converted to broad gauge ) and New Alipurduar railway station is on the New Jalpaiguri-Guwahati main line ( broad gauge ) with a variety of options for trains from all over India .
Alipurduar is on National Highway 31D , with links to NH 31 and NH 31C .
This means easy access to the rest of North Bengal and the North-east .
Large number of buses ply on these routes .

list.item:
Buxa Tiger Reserve
( Located in Buxa National Park - marked on the map ) .
Buxa Tiger Reserve is located near Alipurduar in the eastern Dooars .
Amongst wildlife in the tiger reserve are tiger , leopard ( black panther also ) , elephant , clouded leopard , Himalayan black bear , barking deer , gaur , pangolin , and python .

Buxa Fort
, Buxaduar , Rajabhatkhawa Gram Panchayet , Kalchini block ( The Motorable Road ended at Santrabari Range Office of Buxa Tiger Reserve .
From Santrabari one have to trek 4.9 km ( 1 hour ) via Sadar Bazar . ) , ✉ ecoman.tamal@gmail.com .
Buxa Fort was conquered after the Dooars Bhutan war in 1865 .
The fort was primarily used as a military barracks , to protect the Indo-Bhutan border .
Later used as detainment camp ( 1931-1939 & 1942 -1947 ) for Indian Freedom Fighters .
The 2 km fort is the symbol of Indian Freedom Movement .

Rajabhatkhawa
( 15 km from Alipurduar ) .
It has a railway station on the New Jalpaiguri-Alipurduar-Samuktala line and is also connected by road .
Nature Interpretation Centre and Tiger Rescue Centre are points of interest at Rajabhatkhawa .
Jainti
( Jayanti ) ( 30 km from Alipurduar .
Also approachable from Rajabhatkhawa ) .
Exotic scenic beauty at the foot of the Bhutan Hills , Rich variety of wild life .

Rasik Beel
( South of Kamakhyaguri , about 34 km from Alipurduar ) .
Rasik
Beel is a wet land complex ( in Bengali ,
beel
means large water body ) and bird sanctuary , with such birds as lesser whistling teal , common teal , cotton teal , dapchick , bronze winged jacana , pheasant-tailed janacana , shoveler , barheaded goose , white-eyed poacherd etc.
A 70 feet high watch tower has been constructed by Coochbehar Forest Division .
There is a mini zoo at Rasik Beel , with tortoise , gharial , leopard , spotted deer , peafowl and other inmates .
